Setting Workspace Options

The application's Personal Options feature allows you to select a variety of options that affect the way your workstation operates. The options from which you can choose include:

  • Confirming deletions, moves and shares, and warnings.

  • Displaying tools on the project view window.

  • Indicating the effects of folder and tab changes.

  • Refreshing data automatically.

  • Restoring the workspace on startup.

  • Setting report and output paths.

  • Specifying the contents of the StarTeam.log file.

To customize the application:

  1. Select Tools > Personal Options from the menu bar. The Personal Options dialog opens.

  2. Select the Workspace tab.

  3. In the Confirm options, select or clear the check boxes to indicate whether you wish a confirm dialog to display for:

    • Deletions (selected by default)

    • Move/Share operations and overwrites (selected by default)

    • Warnings (selected by default)

  4. In the Display options:

    • To show or hide toolbars and/or the status bar, select or clear the Toolbar and Status bar check boxes. These options are selected by default.

    • To display time stamps in the Time column of the history pane in UTC times, select the Show history times as UTC. UTC times end in “Z” to differentiate them from local times (Z stands for the "zero meridian", which goes through Greenwich, England.). Clear the check box to display time stamps in local time.

  5. To have StarTeam return to the last folder that was selected for a specific component tab, select the Restore folder selection on tab change check box. If you have not selected a particular tab in this session, StarTeam automatically selects the root folder for the view.

  6. Select the Use the reset scope to local on folder change check box to automatically reset the All Descendants button on the toolbar every time you change a folder. This saves you the time StarTeam would take to scan items. If you clear the check box, you must select the button manually.

  7. Select the Maintain Group State On Folder/Scope Change check box to keep your place in the upper pane even when you change folders or reset the All Descendants button. Clear the check box to collapse all groups when you make a folder or scope change.

  8. Use the Automatic refresh with a maximum delay of ___ minutes text box to set the maximum number of minutes between refreshes of your project. This refresh, the equivalent of pressing Shift + F5, updates the folder hierarchy and the upper pane.

  9. Select the Restore workspace at startup check box to reopen any views that were left open when you exited the application the previous time.

  10. In the Report output path text box, enter or browse for a name and path to which your reports should be sent.

  11. In the Log output path, enter or browse for a name and path for your StarTeam.log files. For additional information, see Reviewing Client Logs.

  12. To define the information that should be sent to the .log files, select the appropriate check boxes:

    • Log errors

    • Log operations that take at least __ milliseconds

    • Log StarTeamMPX events

  13. When the workstation options have been selected, click OK
